intro: Rhagodia nutans, commonly known as the nodding rhagodia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish to reddish flowers that droop downward, giving it its common name. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Rhagodia nutans is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
